title: Dear Men
features: The female sitting across from you............... your child, your friend, your partner - Do you really know her? Are you sure? How sure? After reading this book, you may never look at women the same way again! ****************************** This is one woman s story of a dramatic, challenging, and at times humorous journey through the storms of life and the struggle to hold on to her idealistic search for a Knight In Shining Armor. Having overcome obstacles such as: rapes, abuse, alcoholism, addiction, PTSD, and Bipolar Disorder she finds the path to healing and recovery.
description: Dear Men is a close-up look into a troubled mind in the survival of self-esteem...format is true to the twists and turns of her life s journey... Her style of writing and changes of verb tenses call us into her searching soul... --Carol BoltonStylistically it s fresh, without the cynicism that is alienating some of the chick lit readers...resonates with women who ve had to put others first...It s wonderful and moving, and subtle...writing is good... :) Well done. --Professor Miguel Fernandez

G.P. Bickle is the author of several magazine articles, poems, short stories, and several screenplays. Dear Men, is her true story. A Native Phoenician and a Veteran of the AZANG, U.S. Air Force, U.S. Navy, and has received Honorable Discharges from all three branches of service.
